content: Established in 1995, the Department of Computer Science and Engineering at our institution has been dedicated to providing high-quality education to 240 students. Our mission is to equip young minds with the knowledge and skills necessary to excel in the field of IT and drive organizational success.To achieve this, we offer a comprehensive curriculum that incorporates the latest technologies, collaborative projects, research associations, and hands-on training through semester-long internships and live industry problem-solving. Our program also features flexible electives, open electives, honors, and minor degrees, promoting an interdisciplinary approach that prepares students to thrive in a rapidly evolving tech landscape.

To provide quality education aimed at cultivating exceptionally skilled technologists and entrepreneurs with a global footprint, supported by strong ethical values, and inventive thinking in the field of Computer Science and Engineering, tailored to fulfill both industrial demands and societal aspirations
To focus on delivering education that is both affordable and of high quality, ensuring that it aligns with current industry needs.
To strive for excellence in teaching and learning processes by integrating strong ethical values, inventive thinking, and a focus on entrepreneurship.
To create an environment that encourages innovation supports multidisciplinary research endeavors, and cultivates professionals focused on research excellence in Computer Science and Engineering.
To enhance educational outcomes by nurturing entrepreneurship, integrating project-based learning, and aligning educational efforts with both industrial demands and societal aspirations.

content.content: Graduates should have the ability to analyze engineering problems through strong foundation in Mathematical, Scientific and Engineering fundamentals.
Graduates should have the ability to demonstrate the core competency in solving real time problems, through design and implementation, analyzing the evaluations and making appropriate decisions.
Graduates should have the ability to harness new Computing Technologies through Self-directed studies and Professional development.
Graduates should have the ability to excel as a Professional or an Entrepreneur through Technical Communication skills, Team Building, Inter personal relationship and Leadership qualities.
Graduates should have the ability to apply modern computing technology for the development of the society and ethical values with integrity.
Apply the knowledge of mathematics, science, engineering fundamentals, and an engineering specialization for the solution of complex engineering problems.

Identify, formulate, research literature, and analyze complex engineering problems reaching substantiated conclusions using first principles of mathematics, natural sciences, and engineering sciences.

Design solutions for complex engineering problems and design system components or processes that meet the specified needs with appropriate consideration for public health and safety, and cultural, societal, and environmental considerations.

content.header: PO 4: Conduct investigations of complex problems
content.content: Use research-based knowledge and research methods including design of experiments, analysis and interpretation of data, and synthesis of the information to provide valid conclusions.

Create, select, and apply appropriate techniques, resources, and modern engineering and AI and Data Science tools, including prediction and modelling to complex engineering activities, with an understanding of the limitations.

Apply reasoning informed by the contextual knowledge to assess societal, health, safety, legal and cultural issues and the consequent responsibilities relevant to the professional engineering practice.
Understand the impact of the professional engineering solutions in societal and environmental contexts, and demonstrate the knowledge of, and need for sustainable development.
Apply ethical principles and commit to professional ethics and responsibilities and norms of the engineering practice.
Function effectively as an individual, and as a member or leader in diverse teams, and in multidisciplinary settings.

Communicate effectively on complex engineering activities with the engineering community and with the society at large, such as, being able to comprehend and write effective reports and design documentation, make effective presentations, and give and receive clear instructions.

Demonstrate knowledge and understanding of the engineering and management principles and apply these to one’s own work, as a member and leader in a team, to manage projects and in multidisciplinary environments.
Recognize the need for, and have the preparation and ability to engage in independent and life-long learning in the broadest context of technological change.

Proficient in designing and implementing computing solutions, and use the fundamental knowledge of algorithms, networking Principles, web design, cloud computing, and data analytics to identify research gaps and pioneer innovative solutions

Ability to refine ethical approaches for addressing environmental and social issues, while enhancing interdisciplinary project management skills using IT tools to meet industry and societal demands effectively.

content.name: Dr. MURUGESHWARI B
hod_message: The department is instrumental in conducting various technical and non-technical activities for students as well as faculty members. The focus is not only technical stuff on but also moral values, ethics; professionalism and students are made aware of the latest industry trends and needs in various technological domains. Well-motivated, competent faculty members are always engaged in student’s welfare. Encouragement and guidance is offered to the students for participating in sports and various extracurricular activities to highlight and strengthen their nontechnical skills. Our academic rigor, Plan-Do-Check-Act approach in all sorts of aspects has made this department to be a one of the best choices for UG, PG and PhD admission aspirants.
content.designation: Professor & Head, Dept of Computer Science and Engineering.
